page.title: 10WORKING MENS' CLUB
page.content: The local landowners provided the original room in 1921 as a rest room for Irishmen working in this country picking potatoes on local farms.An extension was built in 1926 at a cost of Â£176-16s. It became the local working mens' club in 1931 when the Bar area was added costing Â£186-19s. The present club is still situated on land owned by The London Distillers Public Limited Company but four trustees are now responsible for it. It is open seven evenings a week as a club and is rented out to other gatherings for daily or evening use.The Local Ladies Guild meets once a month and the Annual Village Flower show is held there.
